h1_38: NYU Long Island School of Medicine Program
h3_39: NYU Long Island School of Medicine
p_63: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_67: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_80: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_98: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_101: Program provides four weeks paid tuition AIRP rotation. Prestigious fellowships after training. Extensive research/scholarly activities. Radiology research seminar. Resident presentations at national meetings. Excellent clinical volume accompanied by strong focus on education. Merges into the NYU Langone System has led to many improvements and advancements in educational and program infrastructure.

p_350: The race/ethnicity data are shown alone or in combination with other race/ethnicity responses. Because some individuals may report multiple races/ethnicities, the totals may not equal 100%. Only residents who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents are included in race/ethnicity counts.
